summary: This is a press statement from Manhattan U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman confirming the death of Jeffrey Epstein by apparent suicide at the Manhattan Correctional Center. The statement emphasizes that the investigation into the sex trafficking conspiracy remains ongoing and urges victims to come forward.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The defendant who faced federal charges of sex trafficking of minors and was found dead in his cell at the Manhattan Correctional Center.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the official statement on Epstein's death, confirming the circumstances and reaffirming the ongoing investigation.

connections.description: Berman, as the U.S. Attorney, was the lead federal prosecutor overseeing the criminal case against Epstein.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Manhattan Correctional Center and pronounced dead of an apparent suicide.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died by apparent suicide in his cell at the Manhattan Correctional Center.
The U.S. Attorney's Office confirmed the death and stated the investigation into the sex trafficking conspiracy remains ongoing.
The statement directly addresses Epstein's victims, urging others to come forward and contact the authorities.
